conclusion: Determine if the distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is greater than or less than 100 meters.
The image shows a velocity-time graph for a skydiver with a straight section from 0 to 10 seconds where velocity increases linearly.
The problem involves calculating the distance fallen by the skydiver during the first 10 seconds using the area under the velocity-time curve.
The graph shows a constant acceleration from 0 to 10 seconds, where the velocity increases linearly.
Calculate the area under the linear section from 0 to 10 seconds using the formula for the area of a triangle: Area = 1/2 * base * height = 1/2 * 10 * 10 = 50 meters.
The distance traveled during this interval is the area under the curve, which is 50 meters.
Comparing this distance (50 meters) to 100 meters, it is less than 100 meters.
The distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is less than 100 meters.
